message.content:
I'll calculate each financial ratio step by step based on the provided financial statements.

### 1. Current Ratio
Current Ratio = Total Current Assets / Total Current Liabilities
= $9,122,854.19 / $3,389,719.66
= 2.69

### 2. Gross Profit Margin
Gross Profit Margin = (Gross Profit / Total Revenue) × 100%
= ($287,062.51 / $791,992.51) × 100%
= 36.25%

### 3. Debt to Asset Ratio
Debt to Asset Ratio = Total Liabilities / Total Assets
= $3,389,719.66 / $19,501,451.49
= 0.17

### 4. Net Profit Margin
Net Profit Margin = (Net Profit / Total Revenue) × 100%
= ($111,731.83 / $791,992.51) × 100%
= 14.11%

### 5. Cash to Current Debt Ratio
Cash to Current Debt Ratio = (Cash on Hand + Bank Deposits) / Total Current Liabilities
= ($927,447.32 + $71,662.08) / $3,389,719.66
= $999,109.40 / $3,389,719.66
= 0.29

### 6. Free Cash Flow (FCF)
FCF = Net Cash Flow from Operating Activities - Capital Expenditures
= -$4,504,752.68 - $2,496,137.92
= -$7,000,890.60

### 7. Return on Assets (ROA)
ROA = (Net Profit / Total Assets) × 100%
= ($111,731.83 / $19,501,451.49) × 100%
= 0.57%

```json
{"solution": {'Current Ratio': '2.69', 'Gross Profit Margin': '36.25%', 'Debt to Asset Ratio': '0.17', 'Net Profit Margin': '14.11%', 'Cash to Current Debt Ratio': '0.29', 'Free Cash Flow (FCF)': '-7000890.60', 'Return on Assets (ROA)': '0.57%'} }
```
